sen.j: 安居院 唱導教団（あぐい しょうどうきょうだん）は日本の南北朝時代 (日本)の仏教宗派の1つ。
sen.e: Agui Shodo Kyodan is one of religious branches of Buddhism in the Period of Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Agui Shodo Kyodan was one of religious branches of Buddhism during the Northern and Southern Courts period (Japan).

sen.j: 『神道集』を編纂したことで知られる。
sen.e: They are known for their editing of "Shintoshu" (collection of shrine legends).
They are known as having edited "Shintoshu (Collection of Shrine Legends)."

sen.j: なお、この集団を指す「安居院唱導教団」という語は、現代の歴史学上の用語であり、当時そう呼ばれていたわけではない。
sen.e: Further the word 'Agui Shodo Kyodan,' indicating this group of people, is a historical term in present days, and they were not called as that in their times.
